bugs.title: CVE-2015-3902 phpMyAdmin: XSRF/CSRF vulnerability in phpMyAdmin setup

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-3902 phpMyAdmin: XSRF/CSRF vulnerability in phpMyAdmin setup

long_desc.thetext:
By deceiving a user to click on a crafted URL, it is possible to alter the 
configuration file being generated with phpMyAdmin setup. Versions 4.0.x
(prior to 4.0.10.10), 4.2.x (prior to 4.2.13.3), 4.3.x (prior to 4.3.13.1)
and 4.4.x (prior to 4.4.6.1) are affected.
phpMyAdmin-4.4.6.1-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-4.4.6.1-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

External References:

http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2015-2.php

Created phpMyAdmin tracking bugs for this issue:

bugs.title: CVE-2015-3903 phpMyAdmin: Vulnerability allowing man-in-the-middle attack on API call to GitHub

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-3903 phpMyAdmin: Vulnerability allowing man-in-the-middle attack on API call to GitHub

long_desc.thetext:
A vulnerability in the API call to GitHub can be exploited to perform a
man-in-the-middle attack. Versions 4.0.x (prior to 4.0.10.10), 4.2.x (prior
to 4.2.13.3), 4.3.x (prior to 4.3.13.1) and 4.4.x (prior to 4.4.6.1) are 
affected.
phpMyAdmin-4.4.6.1-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-4.4.6.1-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

External References:

http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2015-3.php

Created phpMyAdmin tracking bugs for this issue:

Created phpMyAdmin4 tracking bugs for this issue:

Package phpMyAdmin-4.0.10.10-1.el6:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing phpMyAdmin-4.0.10.10-1.el6'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2015-6279/phpMyAdmin-4.0.10.10-1.el6
then log in and leave karma (feedback).
